Class GUI

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
This is the GUI Class for the Corona Tracker Program
Author:
Vincent Ilagan, Ralph Sanson SECTION: S15A
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • GUI

      public GUI()
      Initializes a newly created GUI object. The parent constructor, frame size, panel layout, program icon is initialized, among other things.

  • Method Details

    • init_emptyPanel

      public void init_emptyPanel()
      Creates a panel with no content. It is called to be displayed whenever the GUI does not need to display anything.

    • init_startMenu

      public void init_startMenu()
      Creates a panel that the user sees upon opening the program. The user can select between the options of Registering, Logging in, or Exiting by pressing the corresponding buttons.

    • init_loginMenu

      public void init_loginMenu()
      The user is prompted to enter the Username and Password fields upon selecting the "Login" button in the start-up menu.

    • init_Register_username

      public void init_Register_username()
      Upon selecting "Register" in the main menu, the user is prompted to enter a username that he/she wishes the account to be created on. The Controller will check the availability of the username.

    • init_Register

      public void init_Register()
      The user is prompted to enter the Register form after entering a vacant username. The register form consist of text fields for the password, first name, middle name, surname, home address, office address, telephone, and email address. The Controller will need to check the validity of the password by determining if the password input is a string of characters greater than 6, and consist of at least one special character.

    • init_OfficialAccountOptions

      public void init_OfficialAccountOptions()
      Upon a successful login, the Controller will check whether the user account is an instance of GovernmentOfficial class. This panel shows the buttons that allows a Government Official to swap between Government Official privileges and Citizen options.

    • init_TracerAccountOptions

      public void init_TracerAccountOptions()
      Upon a successful login, the Controller will check whether the user account is an instance of ContactTracer class. This panel shows the buttons that allows a Contact Tracer to swap between Contact Tracer privileges and Citizen options.

    • init_CitizenAccountOptions

      public void init_CitizenAccountOptions()
      This method creates a panel displays the button for a user to view the Citizen options.

    • init_GovMenu

      public void init_GovMenu()
      If the Government Official has selected to view his/her account privileges, the panel that consists of Government Official options is displayed.

    • init_TracerMenu

      public void init_TracerMenu()
      If the Contact Tracer has selected to view his/her account privileges, the panel that consists of Contact Tracer options is displayed.

    • init_CitizenMenu

      public void init_CitizenMenu()
      If the Citizen has selected to view his/her account privileges, the panel that consists of Citizen options is displayed.

    • init_CheckIn

      public void init_CheckIn()
      Upon pressing the "Check In" button from the Citizen account options, the user is prompted to fill in the establishment code and the date.

    • init_ReportPositive

      public void init_ReportPositive()
      Upon pressing the "Report Positive Test Result" button from the Citizen account options, the user is prompted to fill in the date and time.

    • init_UpdateInformation

      public void init_UpdateInformation()
      Upon pressing the "Update Profile Information" button from the Citizen account options, the user is presented with his/her personal data that they can edit. In order to make an edit, the "Change" button of a particular field must be pressed in order to make changes. The user will not be able to exit the menu until all changes are saved.

    • init_showCases

      public void init_showCases()
      This is a JTextArea template that can display text. It is used to display all cases for the Government Officials to view the Citizens who have declared to be positive.

    • init_UnassignedCases

      public void init_UnassignedCases()
      This is a JTextArea template that can display text. It is used to display all unassigned cases for the Government Officials to view the Citizens who have declared to be positive, but hasn't been assigned to a Contact Tracer.

    • init_showUnassignedCases

      public void init_showUnassignedCases()
      Upon selecting "Show Unassigned Cases", the Government Official will see the options between showing the unassigned cases, and the option to assign a Contact Tracer a particular case

    • init_AssignTracer

      public void init_AssignTracer()
      This panel will display two JTextAreas. The left text area will contain the list of unassigned cases, similar to the implementation of init_UnassignedCases(). The right text area will display all Contact Tracers.

    • init_AnalyticsOptions

      public void init_AnalyticsOptions()
      Upon selecting "Show Unassigned Cases", the Government Official will see the options between showing cases within a City and Duration, within a Duration, or within a City. Entering dates must be done by selecting the lowerbound and upperbound date, while the field for City must be entered as well.

    • init_showAnalytics

      public void init_showAnalytics()
      This is a JTextArea template that can display text. It is used to display all cases within certain parameters for the Government Officials to view the Citizens who have declared to be positive, but hasn't been assigned to a Contact Tracer.

    • init_CityAndDuration

      public void init_CityAndDuration()
      The Government Official is presented to enter the form that will require him/her to enter two dates: lowerbound and upperbound, and a City.

    • init_Duration

      public void init_Duration()
      The Government Official is presented to enter the form that will require him/her to enter two dates: lowerbound and upperbound.

    • init_City

      public void init_City()
      The Government Official is presented to enter the form that will require him/her to enter a City.

    • init_CreateOfficial

      public void init_CreateOfficial()
      The Government Official can enter a username for the creation of an account new Government Official account.

    • init_CreateTracer

      public void init_CreateTracer()
      The Government Official can enter a username for the creation of an account new Contact Tracer account.

    • init_TerminateAccount

      public void init_TerminateAccount()
      The Government Official can enter a username for the termination of a Government Official or a Contact Tracer account.

    • init_AssignedCases

      public void init_AssignedCases()
      This is a JTextArea template that can display text. It is used to display all untraced cases for the Contact Tracer to view the Citizens who have declared to be positive, but hasn't been traced by the Contact Tracer.

    • init_TraceCase

      public void init_TraceCase()
      The Contact Tracer will be able to enter the case number of the case that has been assigned to him/her

    • init_CTupdates

      public void init_CTupdates()
      This is a JTextArea template that can display text. It is used to display all Contact Tracing updates for the Contact Tracer to view the Citizens who have either been traced or not.

    • init_popUpNotif

      public void init_popUpNotif()
      Creates a pop-up panel that will display an error for any Citizen who might have been exposed.

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
      Iterates through all the buttons and assigns it an Action Listener that is implemented in the Controller class.
      Parameters:
      al - - the Action Listener implemented by the Controller.

    • getPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel​(java.lang.String x)
      Returns the JPanel with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the panel has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      x - - the name of the panel to be searched for.

    • getTextField

      public javax.swing.JTextField getTextField​(java.lang.String field)
      Returns the JTextField with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the text field has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      field - - the name of the text field to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the text field that the Controller can change its text.

    • getLabel

      public javax.swing.JLabel getLabel​(java.lang.String lbl)
      Returns the JLabel with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the label has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      lbl - - the name of the label to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the label that the Controller can change its color or visibility.

    • getButton

      public javax.swing.JButton getButton​(java.lang.String btn)
      Returns the JButton with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the button has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      btn - - the name of the button to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the button that the Controller can change its text.

    • getBox

      public javax.swing.JComboBox getBox​(java.lang.String box)
      Returns the JComboBox with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the combo box has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      box - - the name of the text field to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the combo box that the Controller can change retrieve the value of the selected index.

    • getPasswordField

      public javax.swing.JPasswordField getPasswordField​(java.lang.String field)
      Returns the JPasswordField with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the password field has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      field - - the name of the password field to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the password field that the Controller can retrieve the content.

    • getTextArea

      public javax.swing.JTextArea getTextArea​(java.lang.String txtArea)
      Returns the JTextArea with the same name specified by the String parameter. If the text area has not been found, this method will return null.
      Parameters:
      txtArea - - the name of the text area to be searched for.
      Returns:
      the text area that the Controller can set its text to display.

    • showMenu

      public void showMenu​(java.lang.String x)
      Allows the Controller to display a particular button menu panel after an Event.
      Parameters:
      x - - the name of the panel to be displayed into the GUI interface.

    • showInterface

      public void showInterface​(java.lang.String x)
      Allows the Controller to display a particular button interface panel after an Event.
      Parameters:
      x - - the name of the panel to be displayed into the GUI interface.

    • currentMenu

      public java.lang.String currentMenu()
      Retrieves the name of the current visible menu panel in the GUI interface. It is used by other methods to index through the button panels that is visible.
      Returns:
      the name of the visible button panel.

    • getCurrentMenu

      public java.lang.String getCurrentMenu()
      Retrieves the name of the current visible menu panel in the GUI interface. It is used by other methods to index through the button panels that is visible.
      Returns:
      the name of the visible button panel.

    • setTextFieldText

      public void setTextFieldText​(javax.swing.JTextField txtField, java.lang.String name)
      Changes the text of the JTextField to a specified text.
      Parameters:
      txtField - - the JTextField object that the method will set its text with the name parameter.
      name - - the String that will be set to the text field.

    • parseInt

      public int parseInt​(java.lang.String num)
      Attempts to parse a String input to its int value. It will return 0 if the user makes an invalid non-number input as String.
      Parameters:
      num - - the input String that will be attempted to be converted into an int.
      Returns:
      the specified int value of the String is returned. The int value 0 is returned if the String is not a valid input.

    • displayPreviousMenu

      public void displayPreviousMenu()
      Displays the previous menu of the buttonPanels.

    • getCurrentInterface

      public java.lang.String getCurrentInterface()
      Retrieves the name of the current visible interface panel in the GUI interface. It is used by other methods to index through the interface panels that is visible.
      Returns:
      the name of the visible button panel.

    • clearTextFields

      public void clearTextFields()
      Clears the content of all objects of JTextField, JPasswordField, and JComboBox.
